intro: Lasthenia bridgesii, commonly known as the Bridges' commonness, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its small yellow flowers bloom in spring, and it produces hairy, elongated seed capsules. It is often found in coastal and inland areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
